ai:cl.c: High-level audio sample playback interface with intelligent resource management and format detection.

ai:a.c: Stops the audio sample and resets the playback position.
Disable playback of an active audio sample, equivalent to pausing.
Continues playing a sound if it has been disabled.

ai:a.p: ERR acGetKey(*Object, CSTRING Key, STRING Value, INT Size)

ai:i.c: The name of a key value.
Pointer to a buffer space large enough to hold the retrieved value.
Indicates the byte size of the Buffer.

ai:a.c: Read decoded audio from the sound sample.
ai:a.p: ERR acRead(*Object, APTR Buffer, INT Length, INT *Result)

ai:i.c: Points a buffer that will receive the data.
The total number of bytes to read from the object. This value cannot exceed the size of the Buffer.
The Read action will write this parameter with the total number of bytes read into the Buffer.

ai:a.c: Saves audio sample data to an object.
ai:a.p: ERR acSaveToObject(*Object, OBJECTID Dest, CLASSID ClassID)

ai:i.c: Refers to an object that will receive the encoded data.
Can refer to a sub-class that should be used when encoding the data.

ai:a.c: Moves the cursor position for reading data.
ai:a.p: ERR acSeek(*Object, DOUBLE Offset, INT Position)

ai:i.c: The desired offset to seek to, relative to the Position parameter.
The position that defines the starting point for Offset.

ai:a.c: Define custom tags that will be saved with the sample data.
ai:a.p: ERR acSetKey(*Object, CSTRING Key, CSTRING Value)

ai:i.c: The name of the target key.
The string value to associate with Key.

ai:f.c: Returns true if the sound sample is being played back.
Refers to the audio object/device to use for playback.
Indicates the sample rate of the audio sample, typically 8 or 16 bit.
The flow of bytes-per-second when the sample is played at normal frequency.
Refers to the channel that the sound is playing through.
Determines the amount of compression used when saving an audio sample.
Returns the duration of the sample, measured in seconds.
Optional initialisation flags.
The frequency of a sampled sound is specified here.
Contains the first 128 bytes of data in a sample's file header.
Indicates the total byte-length of sample data.
The byte position at which sample looping will end.
The byte position at which sample looping begins.
The musical note to use when playing a sound sample.
The octave to use for sample playback.
This callback is triggered when sample playback stops.
Determines the horizontal position of a sound when played through stereo speakers.
Location of the audio sample data.
The playback frequency of the sound sample can be defined here.
The current playback position.
The priority of a sound in relation to other sound samples being played.
Defines the preferred streaming method for the sample.
The volume to use when playing the sound sample.
